1.value: Identifies materials and organisms such as plant fibre, flowers on the basis of observable features i.e. appearance, texture, aroma, function etc

2.value: Differentiates materials and organisms such as fibre and yarn, tap and fibrous roots; electrical conductors and insulators on basis of their properties, function and structure

3.value: Classifies materials, organisms and processes based on observable properties e.g.materials as solubles, insoluble, transparent, translucent and opaque; changes as can be reversed and can't be reversed; plants as herbs, shrubs, trees, creepers, climbers; components of habitat as biotic, abiotic; motion as rectilinear, circular and periodic

4.value: Conducts simple investigations to seek answers to queries e.g. what are the food nutrient present in animal fodder? can all physical changes be reversed? does a freely suspended magnet align in particular direction?

5.value: Relates processes and pheomena with causes e.g. deficiency disease with diet, adaptations of animals and plants with their habitats; quality of air with pollutants etc

6.value: Explains processes and phenomena e.g. processing of plant fibres; movements in plants and animals; formation of shadows; reflection of light from plane mirror; variation in composition of air; preparation of vermicompost etc

7.value: Measures physical quantitites and expresses in S.I unit e.g. Length, mass, temp etc

8.value: Draws labelled diagrams/ flow charts of organisms and processes e.g. parts of flowers; joints; filtration; water cycle etc

9.value: Constructs models using materials from surroundings and explains their working e.g. pinhole camera, periscope, electric torch etc

10.value: Applies learning of scienctific concepts in day to day life e.g selecting food items for a balanced diet; separating materials; selectig season appropriate fabrics; using compass needle for finding directions;suggesting ways to cope with heavy rain/drought etc

11.value: Makes efforts to protect environment e.g minimising wastage of food, water, electricity and generation of waste; spreading awareness of rain water harvesting; care for plants etc

12.value: Exhibits values of honesty, objectivity, cooperation, freedom from fear and prejudices

3.description: Students will engage in discovering properties of parallelograms by plotting points on a coordinate plane, calculating slopes, measuring angles and calculating distances of side lengths. Additionally, students will make conjectures about the relationship between diagonals in a parallelogram and how they bisect one another.
